name: Mycophenolate Mofetil
indications: mycophenolate mofetil ( mmf ) indicated prophylaxis organ rejection , recipients allogeneic kidney [ ( 14.1 ) ] , heart [ ( 14.2 ) ] liver transplants [ ( 14.3 ) ] , combination immunosuppressants .
contraindications: adults dosing kidney transplant 1 g twice daily orally ( 2.2 ) heart transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally ( 2.3 ) liver transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally ( 2.4 ) pediatrics kidney transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily , maximum 2 g daily ( 2.2 ) reduce interrupt dosing event neutropenia . ( 2.5 ) full prescribing information ( fpi ) : adjustments renal impairment neutropenia . ( 2.5 )
adverseReactions: allergic mycophenolate mofetil observed ; therefore , mycophenolate mofetil contraindicated patients hypersensitivity mycophenolate mofetil ( mmf ) , mycophenolic acid ( mpa ) component product .
indications_original:
Mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) is indicated for the prophylaxis of organ rejection, in recipients of allogeneic kidney
 
  [see
  
   Clinical Studies (14.1)],
 
  heart
 
  [see
  
   Clinical Studies (14.2)]
 
  or liver transplants
 
  [see
  
   Clinical Studies (14.3)]
 
  , in combination with other immunosuppressants.
contraindications_original: ADULTS DOSING Kidney Transplant 1 g twice daily orally ( 2.2 ) Heart Transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally ( 2.3 ) Liver Transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally ( 2.4 ) PEDIATRICS Kidney Transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily, up to maximum of 2 g daily ( 2.2 ) Reduce or interrupt dosing in the event of neutropenia. ( 2.5 ) See full prescribing information (FPI) for: adjustments for renal impairment and neutropenia. ( 2.5 )
adverseReactions_original: Allergic reactions to mycophenolate mofetil have been observed; therefore, mycophenolate mofetil is contraindicated in patients with a hypersensitivity to mycophenolate mofetil (MMF), mycophenolic acid (MPA) or any component of the drug product.
